snippet: In a complaint to the Federal Election Commission, the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee accuses Republican-leaning tax-exempt organizations of campaign activity.
abstract: Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee will file a formal complaint with the Federal Election Commission against three big Republican campaign groups, accusing them of willful violations of federal election law and asking that their electioneering be stopped; complaint begins a new phase in the Democrats’ struggle to keep pace with Republicans since the Supreme Court’s 2010 Citizens United ruling.
lead_paragraph: In a complaint to the Federal Election Commission, the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee accuses Republican-leaning tax-exempt organizations of campaign activity.

headline.seo: Democrats Want F.E.C. to Restrict Donor-Shielding Groups
headline.main: Democrats to Ask for Curbs on Donor-Shielding Groups
headline.print_headline: Democrats to Ask for Curbs On Donor-Shielding Groups
